properties.desc_short: Fractured Martian crust in Sirenum Fossae

properties.name: Northern Hemisphere
properties.desc_short: Mars upside down
properties.desc_long: Global views of planets are usually mapped with the North Pole at the top and the South Pole at the bottom – not the case in this HRSC image, taken from a high altitude when the Mars Express flew from north to south…

properties.name: Neukum Crater
properties.desc_short: The Neukum Crater on Mars – Martian crater named after German planetary scientist
properties.desc_long: Neukum Crater stands out for its complex inner structure: the eye is drawn to a large, dark field of dunes and two low depressions on the crater floor. Landslide deposits and possible glacial structures can also be seen on the inner crater rim…

properties.name: Ismenia Patera
properties.desc_short: Ismenia Patera – impact crater or supervolcano?
properties.desc_long: Ismenia Patera is situated in the region Arabia Terra, at the transition of the northern lowlands and the southern highlands on Mars. Hills and blocks accumulate in a ring around the center of the 75 kilometer wide crater…

properties.name: Neukum Crater Animation
properties.desc_short: Flight over Neukum Crater on Mars
properties.desc_long: The 102-kilometer-diameter Neukum Impact Crater is located in the Noachis Terra region on Mars, in the densely cratered Southern Highlands and roughly 800 kilometers from the eastern rim of the large Hellas Planitia impact basin…

properties.name: 15 years special
properties.desc_short: 15 Years HRSC on Mars Express – Mars from horizon to horizon
properties.desc_long: On 2nd June 2018 is the 15th anniversary of the launch of the European Mars Express spacecraft. Still in orbit around Mars today, it marks one of the most successful space missions ever send to Mars…

properties.name: Dust storm
properties.desc_short: Announcing this year's dust storm season on Mars
properties.desc_long: Shown in this HRSC color image captured in April 2018 is a precursor of this year’s unusual intense dust storm season on Mars. This small-scale, local storm front is situated north of Utopia Planitia, in the vicinity of the north polar ice cap of Mars�

properties.name: Cerberus Fossae
properties.desc_short: Recent tectonics on Mars in the Ceberus Fossae
properties.desc_long: The Cerberus Fossae are two parallel extensional faults that run almost 1000 kilometres across a young volcanic plain in the Elysium Planitia region. The two trenches run almost exactly parallel to one another and stretch from northwest to southeast…

properties.name: Greeley Crater
properties.desc_short: Major crater pays tribute to a leading planetary scientist
properties.desc_long: In 2015 the International Astronomical Union (IAU) named the impact crater shown in this image mosaic from the High Resolution Stereo Camera (HRSC) after the US scientist Ronald Greeley, who passed away in 2011...

properties.name: North of Nili Fossae
properties.desc_short: From hills to valleys – material transport on Mars
properties.desc_long: The images show a hilly landscape scored through by a myriad of furrows. This area lies on what is known as Mars' dichotomy boundary, or sometimes as the highland-lowland boundary…

properties.name: Korolev Crater
properties.desc_short: Winter wonderland in red and white
properties.desc_long: The impact crater Korolev is situated in the northern lowlands of Mars, south of the large dune field Olympia Undae that surrounds part of the north polar cap. Water ice is permanently stable within Korolev crater…

properties.name: East of Huygens
properties.desc_short: Signs of ancient flowing on Mars
properties.desc_long: The images show a network of meandering valleys across the landscape, all of which follow a dendritic, ramified or branched pattern. In hydrology, the term 'dendritic' is derived from 'dendron' (Greek for tree) and describes a valley into which…

properties.name: Chalcoporos Rupes
properties.desc_short: Who left the dark tracks on Mars?
properties.desc_long: The dark, narrow, thread-like stripes that can be seen in the images are the traces of small whirlwinds – known as dust devils – which are caused by atmospheric turbulence…

properties.name: Lowell Crater
properties.desc_short: The Martian impact crater Lowell
properties.desc_long: The impact crater, which is between 3.7 and 3.9 billion years old, is located in the Aonia Terra region of the southern Martian highlands. Over the course of millions of years, Lowell Crater has been altered by erosion…

properties.name: Aurorae Chaos
properties.desc_short: Aurorae Chaos – catastrophic collapse by water masses?
properties.desc_long: Aurorae Chaos is part of a large-scale system of depressions east of the Valles Marineris canyon. The up to 600 kilometers wide irregular shaped basin has a depth of about four kilometers with respect to the surrounding plains…

properties.name: Terra Cimmeria
properties.desc_short: Dark meets light on Mars
properties.desc_long: Bright and dark regions on Mars can actually be distinguished from Earth by telescope. They differ by composition and particle size: bright regions are mostly covered by fine dust from silicate minerals, whereas dark regions are dominated by…

properties.name: Total Mars
properties.desc_short: Marvellous Mars – from the north pole to the southern highlands
properties.desc_long: The upper part of this striking global view of Mars shows the northern hemisphere and the North Pole ice cap in winter. A thin veil of clouds stretches from there across the adjoining deep valleys, some of which are covered with dark sand…

properties.name: Nirgal Vallis
properties.desc_short: The Nirgal Vallis river valley on Mars
properties.desc_long: Nirgal Vallis is the relict of a stream that once flowed over the surface of Mars. It is a typical example of an amphitheater-headed valley, characterized by steep-sided valley walls, smooth valley floors, and U-shaped cross sections…

properties.name: Deuteronilus Mensae
properties.desc_short: Glacial landforms in Deuteronilus Mensae
properties.desc_long: Deuteronilus Mensae is situated at the transition from the rugged and cratered southern highlands to the smooth northern lowlands, referred to as the Martian hemispheric dichotomy. The landscape here at the dichotomy boundary…

properties.name: Nereidum Montes
properties.desc_short: The Nereidum Montes – mountain range on Mars show off
properties.desc_long: Tectonic forces delivered by the giant Argyre impact, building up the mountain range as crater rim. Fluvial processes, carving impressive dendritic drainage patterns into the ground and documenting the water-rich history of Mars…

properties.name: Nilosyrtis Mensae
properties.desc_short: Nilosyrtis Mensae – erosion on a large scale
properties.desc_long: The region Nilosyrtis Mensae is delineated fretted terrain, because of its numerous labyrinth-like valleys that often exhibit viscous flow features. Dissection by water and ice left rounded hills and mesas…

properties.name: Pyrrhae Regio
properties.desc_short: Birth of chaos – craters and collapses in Pyrrhae regio
properties.desc_long: Chaotic terrains are formed by collapse of the surface overlying an ice and sediment containing reservoir. The ice melts for example triggered by lava flows, by volcanic intrusions at greater depth or by impacts…

properties.name: East of Le Verrier
properties.desc_short: Crater triplets east of Le Verrier on Mars
properties.desc_long: The image shows three interconnected impact craters, the largest measuring about 45 km and the smaller one 28 km in diameter. Apparently, the impactor broke up into at least three large pieces before hitting the ground...

properties.name: Polar Clouds
properties.desc_short: Cloud Formations at the north polar ice cap of Mars
properties.desc_long: The north polar ice cap of Mars changes its face during the course of the year: a permanent cap composed mainly of water ice is observed in the summer season, as shown in this HRSC image…

properties.name: Moreux Crater
properties.desc_short: Mars crater Moreux and its dark dunes
properties.desc_long: Moreux Crater on Mars has a diameter of 135 kilometers and a depth of three kilometers measured from the rim. It is located in the Protonilus region at the Martian highland-lowland boundary…

properties.name: North of Labeatis Fossae
properties.desc_short: North of Labeatis Fossae – sculpted by nature
properties.desc_long: The region shown on the HRSC images shows a so-called horst and graben tectonics, as in the textbook. If a rigid, brittle rock crust is stretched, for example because the ground is raised, the surface above it comes under tension…

properties.name: Jezero Crater Animation
properties.desc_short: Jezero Crater – german stereo camera HRSC flies over NASA's Mars 2020 landing site
properties.desc_long: Jezero is an impact crater with a diameter of about 45 km, located at the rim of the giant Isidis impact basin. Morphological evidence suggests, that the crater once hosted a lake, some 3.5 billion years ago…

properties.name: Dark Angel
properties.desc_short: Dark Angel – big heart – Mars is ready for christmas
properties.desc_long: The South Polar Ice Cap shows a diameter of 400 km and a mean thickness of 1.5 km and is much smaller than the Northern Ice Cap. It stretches up to 50° southern latitude. Its volume is estimated to 1.6 million km3, 0.2 km3 consist of water ice…

properties.name: Korolev Crater Animation
properties.desc_short: Flight over the ice-filled Koroloev Crater
properties.desc_long: The impact crater Korolev is situated in the northern lowlands of Mars, south of the large Olympia Undae dune field that partly surrounds the north polar cap. Korolev’s crater floor lies two kilometers below its rim, and is covered whole year…

properties.name: Ius and Tithonium Chasma
properties.desc_short: Ius and Tithonium Chasma – unequal siblings
properties.desc_long: Tithonium and Ius Chasma are the northern and southern trenches in the western troughs of the giant Valles Marineris canyon system, the largest canyon system in our solar system…

properties.name: Utopia Planitia
properties.desc_short: Utopia Planitia – the frozen beauty
properties.desc_long: Utopia Planitia is one of three major topographic basins in the northern hemisphere of Mars and shows a diameter 3,300 km. It is interpreted to represent an ancient impact basin that was variably filled by a mix of sediments…

properties.name: Aonia Terra
properties.desc_short: Aonia Terra – colorful Mars
properties.desc_long: Aonia Terra is an upland region in the southern highlands of Mars and known for massive cratering like the 200 km large and famous Lowell crater just 130 km southwest of the crater shown in the center of the image…

properties.name: Tantalus Fossae
properties.desc_short: Tantalus Fossae – tantaliting tectonics
properties.desc_long: The Tantalus Fossae are a set of giant faults and fractures, located on the eastern side of Alba Patera in the Arcadia quadrangle. They are referred as grabens and the result of extensional forces associated with the uplift of the Alba Patera volcano…

properties.name: Jovis Tholus
properties.desc_short: Jovis Tholus volcano – sunken in a lava sea
properties.desc_long: The Jovis Tholus shield volcano is located roughly in the middle between Olympus Mons and Ascreus Mons. The about 1 km high volcano has a diameter of 58 km and shows a large off-center caldera complex some 28 km in diameter…

properties.name: Medusae Fossae
properties.desc_short: The Medusae Fossae formation at Eumenides dorsum – wind at work
properties.desc_long: The Eumenides Dorsum mountain range is located west of the Tharsis region and is part of the Medusae Fossae Formation (MFF). The MFF itself is a very extensive geological formation found along the Martian highland-lowland boundary…

properties.name: The Landing of Perseverance
properties.desc_short: The landing of Perseverance – NASA's Mars rover
properties.desc_long: Jezero crater was chosen for a good reason as landing site. Two ancient river deltas can be found inside the crater. Within the delta deposits, numerous water-bearing minerals have been found, indicating, that liquid water was once present...

properties.name: Holden Basin
properties.desc_short: Holden Basin – chaotic floor mystery
properties.desc_long: Located in the ancient Noachia Terra region within the Margaritifer Sinus quadrangle, the Holden Basin lies adjacent to Holden crater, named after the American astronomer Edward Singleton Holden (1846-1914)...
